subject: AI & Agents
title: The Myth of the Useless Human
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Myth of the Useless Human.

hook.text: If AI can write, code, and create, what's left for humans to do? More than you think.

buildup.text: AI lacks judgment, ethical reasoning, physical dexterity, and genuine social connection.

discovery.text: Nurses, teachers, therapists, and leaders rely on empathy and trust ‚Äî things AI simulates but doesn't have.

twist.text: Demand for human connection may actually increase as AI handles routine tasks.

climax.text: The most valuable skills in an AI world might be the most human: creativity, empathy, and judgment.

punchline.text: Machines got smarter. Being human became more valuable.

quiz.question: What uniquely human skills become more valuable in an AI-driven world?
options: Empathy, judgment, and genuine social connection
